title: Stacey Copeland
text:
Stacey Copeland (born 19 August 1981) is an English <a href="professional%20boxer">professional boxer</a> and former <a href="soccer">football</a> player who has held the <a href="Commonwealth%20Boxing%20Council">Commonwealth</a> female <a href="super-welterweight">super-welterweight</a> title since 2018. As an <a href="Amateur%20boxing">amateur</a> she won a silver medal at the <a href="2014%20Women%27s%20European%20Amateur%20Boxing%20Championships">2014 European Championships</a>.
Professional career.
Copeland made her professional debut on 16 June 2017, scoring a four-round <a href="points%20decision">points decision</a> (PTS) victory Borislava Goranova at the Bowlers Exhibition Centre in <a href="Manchester">Manchester</a>, England.
After compiling a record of 4–0 (2 KOs), she faced Mapule Ngubane for the inaugural <a href="List%20of%20Commonwealth%20Boxing%20Council%20female%20champions%23Super%20welterweight">Commonwealth female super-welterweight title</a> on 13 July 2018 at the International Convention Centre in <a href="Harare">Harare</a>, Zimbabwe. Copeland defeated Ngubane via <a href="unanimous%20decision">unanimous decision</a> (UD) over ten rounds with scores of 98–91, 98–93 and 97–92. With the win, Copeland became the first British female boxer to win a Commonwealth title.
